subject: Ensure autoscaling actions occur for percentage adjustment
commit_message:
Ensure autoscaling actions occur for percentage adjustment

Fixes bug 1251007

Previously if the AdjustmentType was set to PercentChangeInCapacity,
then depending on the choice of the instance group MinSize and the
scale-up policy ScalingAdjustment, no autoscaling actions may occur
even when the under-scaled alarm fires.

This situation occurred if:

   (MinSize * ScalingAdjustment / 100.0) < 1.0

in which case the group never get gets scaled up even if the under-
scaled alarm stays in the alarm state forever.

Now we follow the rounding rules used by AWS Autoscaling:

  http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/DeveloperGuide/as-scale-based-on-demand.html

subject: Add a specialized Event Type model and db table
commit_message:
Add a specialized Event Type model and db table

As the events API gets fleshed out and more robust,
it will become increasingly necessary to ensure that the
database schema modeling events has the ability to quickly
retrieve a list of event types. With the current schema
having a foreign key from event to unique_name (the
monolithic generic string key lookup table), in order to
get a simple list of event types, one needs to do the following:

SELECT DISTINCT e.unique_name FROM event;

Not only is this inefficient, but the readability of the
model and database schema suffers from the generalization of
the unique name field relationship. With this patch, a new
event_type table is added to the schema to allow for quick
and easy lookups of event types like so:

SELECT id, desc FROM event_type;

This will lead to future ability to categorize
event types with ease. Instead of adding columns to the
monolithic unique_name table, we would only need to add a foreign
key relationship to the new event_type table tying the event_type
to a future event_type_class table...

Note: this is a resubmittal of an earlier patch from Jay Pipes
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41316/)

Change-Id: Ia57c2425d2431cea41c71904cb1d3511a4633aa8
Partial-Bug: 1211015

subject: Separate a deployment from a benchmark
commit_message:
Separate a deployment from a benchmark

A deployment was separated from a benchmark on several levels:

-   The Deployment model represents an installation of OpenStack. This
    model is related with the Task model through a many-to-one relation.

-   A set of operations extends the rally.db.api.* to store a deployment
    related data.

-   rally.db.deploy.Deployment is an abstraction of the data relating to
    the deployment.

-   EngineFactory provides an abstraction to manage specific deployment
    engines, control status of a process and handle errors. Very
    closely associated with the Deployment object and in role of a
    context manager controls its status:

        # Create instance of the Deployment
        deployment = rally.db.deploy.Deployment(config={
            "name": "DevstackEngine",
            "provider": {
                "name": "DummyProvider",
                "credentials": ["root@10.2.0.8"]
            }
        })

        # Performe of deployment
        with rally.deploy.engine.get_engine(deployment) as deploy:
            endpoint = deploy.deploy() #raised an exception

        # If failure occur into context of deploy the status of
        # deployment would be changed to "deploy->failed".

        # If some test broke the deployment e.g.:
        with rally.deploy.engine.get_engine(deployment) as deploy:
            ...
            tester.benchmark() #raised an exception
        # the status would be changed to "deploy->divergent".

-   The orchestration provides management operations on deployments.

-   Support of deployment commands into CLI.

Implements: blueprint independent-deploy

Change-Id: I8da5d6bfd969960ec452256dcf4a3bb21505e537

subject: Check if dir exists before calling listdir
commit_message:
Check if dir exists before calling listdir

Changes along the way to how we clean up and detach after
copying an image to a volume exposed a problem in the cleanup
of the brick/initiator routines.

The clean up in the initiator detach was doing a blind listdir
of /dev/disk/by-path, however due to detach and cleanup being
called upon completion of the image download to the volume if
there are no other devices mapped in this directory the directory
is removed.

The result was that even though the create and copy of the image
was succesful, the HostDriver code called os.lisdir on a directory
that doesn't exist any longer and raises an unhandled exception that
cause the taskflow mechanism to mark the volume as failed.

Change-Id: I488755c1a49a77f42efbb58a7a4eb6f4f084df07
Closes-bug: #1243980
(cherry picked from commit 1766a5acc5c948288b4cd81c62d0c1507c55f727)

Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version

In the images api, we depend on iso8601 to parse some dates and times.
Recently, since version 0.1.4, python-iso8601 added support for a few
more formats, and we finally got some other issues nailed down by 0.1.8.
If end user switch from 0.1.8 back to 0.1.4 in the deployment, the image
api will lose support for certain datetime formats like YYYY-MM-DD

a compatibility concern.

We were resolved to make glance compatible with both iso 0.1.4 and

a large swath of iso8601 0.1.8 in glance itself.

subject: Closes-Bug: 1247296
commit_message:
Closes-Bug: 1247296

Always upload a snapshot as a preallocated disk

Currently, a snapshot operation always produces a preallocated disk type. When the snapshot is
uploaded to glance, the source image metadata is uploaded with the new snapshot and then some of
the metadata properties are updated. The update doesn't include the disk_type property, this can be
problematic. If the original image has a sparse disk type and a snapshot is taken, then the snapshot
which is a preallocated disk type is uploaded to glance with the disk_type  property set to sparse,
which creates a type mismatch and causes errors when a vm is spawned from that snapshot. This patch
addresses the issue by correcting the image metadata used when uploading a snapshot to glance.

Also, the image_upload function in vmwareapi/fake.py has been modified to address the change. Any
function call to image_upload (from the unit tests) will assert that the metadata for the image to be
uploaded must have the disk_type value to be preallocated.

subject: Add WSGI environment to context
commit_message:
Add WSGI environment to context

The environment dictionary contains an unspecified set of variables
that contain information about the authentication and authorization
processes.  Not all of the values are known ahead of time.  The
two values for Kerberos (REMOTE_USER, AUTH_TYPE) are a subset.

Instead of making the WSGI layer know about a growing superset of
authentication attributes, the context contains a link to the wsgi
environment.  The environment is removed from the request dictionary
to prevent circular references and potential GC issues.

Fixed tests  to set environment in the context.  While this
changed many tests, the alternative was to make the check
for the environment optional in the controllers.  This is not a
realistic way to test.  If context['environment'] it missing, a test

subject: Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version

Adopt 0.1.8 as iso8601 minimum version

In the images api, we depend on iso8601 to parse some dates and times.
Recently, since version 0.1.4, python-iso8601 added support for a few
more formats, and we finally got some other issues nailed down by 0.1.8.
If end user switch from 0.1.8 back to 0.1.4 in the deployment, the image
api will lose support for certain datetime formats like YYYY-MM-DD
(where the time part is assumed to be all zeros). This obviously creates
a compatibility concern.

We were resolved to make glance compatible with both iso 0.1.4 and
0.1.8, but it appears that to do so requires essentially reimplementing
a large swath of iso8601 0.1.8 in glance itself.

Fixes bug: 1242501

subject: Enable del of other tenant's instance by name
commit_message:
Enable del of other tenant's instance by name

Currently, due to the way that instances are being retrieved by the
findall() function, an administrator can do a list, etc. with the
--all_tenants option and see other tenants' instances.  If the
admin then tries to delete the another tenants' instance by name, it fails
with a 'No server with a name or ID of <name> exists.' error.

The solution to this is to change the call to the list() function in
findall() to set the all_tenants search option to 1.  This causes the
admin to get a list of all the instances that they have access to back
when the search is done instead of just a list of their resources.  The
delete by name is then possible.  The server takes care of ensuring that
only resources that the user has access to are returned.

This will enable delete by name for all resources that use the find_instance
function.

subject: Whole Host Allocation - Pcloud framework
commit_message:
Whole Host Allocation - Pcloud framework

Work In Progress

This change introduces the basic framework for creating and managing
pclouds (private clouds), which can be used by projects to work with a
dedicated pool of hosts.   Unlike existing tenant isolation filters which
have to be configured by the cloud provider, pclouds are directly accessible
to users (subject to quotas and authorization of course)

Pclouds are implemented as a wrapper on top of host aggregates and exploit
other aggregate based features such as the AggregateCoreFilter and
AggregateRamFilter.

Hosts are allocated from host-flavors, which has its own management
API extension.

A Scheduler filter to allow authorised tenants to schedule into a Pcloud
is included.

This version includes the capability to allocate hosts into a Pcloud

For a full description of the design and examples of using via the
Nova client refer to these wiki pages:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/WholeHostAllocation
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/WholeHostAllocation-pcloud-example

At this stage this is fully working code, but still needs more work on
unit tests.   It's being posted as WIP to allow some of the other dependant
changes to progress, and to collect comments on the overall approach.

ToDo:
- Add unit tests
- Add v3 API
- Convert to Aggregate Objects

Other changes will build on this to provide:
